author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 18 passengers including seven women sustained injuries when a TNSTC bus and a cement-laden lorry collided near the Kuzhithurai-Vettumani junction while the bus took a turn on the main road about 5.30 a.m. on Friday.

The accident took place when the bus with around 20 passengers from Shoozhal near Kollencode plying to Marthandam was about to cross the Kuzhithurai-Vettumani junction.

The lorry hit the middle portion of the bus leaving 18 passengers injured. Hearing the screams of the passengers, the local residents rushed to their rescue.

Residents come to rescue

Before the rescue personnel from police and Fire and Rescue services reached the spot, the locals rescued the inured and sent them to Kuzhithurai Government Hospital and a few other private hospitals.

The condition of the injured was said to be stable, hospital sources said.

The cement lorry driver fled the accident spot. Due to the accident, traffic on this route was affected for some time.

Police removed the lorry from the middle of the road and regulated the traffic.

Marthandam police have registered a case and are further investigating.
title: 18 injured as TNSTC bus and cement-laden lorry collide
